q2.body: What passage teaches that God's election is based on God's foreknowledge (evidently of who chooses to believe in Christ)?

This is a verse that teaches that God exists in more than 1 person.
Which of these is the best reference and quote for Jesus' qualities in the Hypostatic Union?

options.text: Phil 2:6,7 `For who, being completely God, did not consider equality with God something to be used to his own advantage; rather he made himself everything by taking the nature of God, spiritually like a person`
Col 2:9 `For in Christ the fullness of deity dwells in bodily form.`
Col 2:9 `For in Christ, deity seemed like a man.`

Phil 2:6,7 `For who, being in very nature God, did not consider equality with God something to be used to his own advantage; rather he made himself nothing by taking the very nature of a servant, being made in human likeness`

q2.body: Which of these is the best reference and quote for how 'Jesus laid aside his divine privileges (including the use of certain divine attributes) at the Incarnation:

options.text: Phil 2:6,7 'For who,being completely God, did not consider equality with God something to be used to his own advantage;rather he made himself everything by taking the nature of God, spiritually like a person
Col 2:9 'For in Christ the fullness of diety dwells in bodily form.'
Col 2:9 'For in Christ, deity appeared like a man.

Phil 2:6,7 'For who, being in very nature God, did not consider equality with God something to be used to his own advange;rather he made himself nothing by taking the very nature of a servant, being made in human likeness

q0.body: Match these accessibility guidelines to their A-Level
options: Color is not used as the only visual means of conveying information, indicating an action, prompting a response, or distinguishing a visual element.
All functionality of the content is operable through a keyboard interface without requiring specific timings for individual keystrokes.
If an input error is automatically detected and suggestions for correction are known, then the suggestions are provided to the user, unless it would jeopardize the security or purpose of the content.

q1.body: Select the verse best describing apologetics
Match the verses to their content.
options: Rejoice with those who rejoice, and weep with those who weep.
I myself am convinced, my brothers, that you yourselves are full of goodness, complete in knowledge and competent to instruct one another.
And do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what the will of God is, that which is good and acceptable and perfect.

q1.body: Hebrews 11:3
dictionary: By faith we understand that the universe was formed at God's command, so that what is seen was not made out of what was visible.
q1.response: By faith we understand that the universe was formed at God's command, so that what is seen was not made out of what was visible.

q1.body: 2 Cor 5:11a
dictionary: Since, then, we know what it is to fear the Lord, we try to persuade men.
q1.response: Since, then, we know what it is to fear the Lord, we try to persuade men.

q1.body: It was Paulâ€™s custom to go the Synagogue, reason from the Scriptures, and persuade men that Christ had to suffer and rise on the third day.
Paul speaks in Athens at the Areopagus. This is an example of a contextualized apologetics approach.
2 Corinthians 10:5
dictionary: We demolish arguments and every pretension that sets itself up against the knowledge of God, and we take captive every thought to make it obedient to Christ.
q1.response: We demolish arguments and every pretension that sets itself up against the knowledge of God, and we take captive every thought to make it obedient to Christ.

q1.response: The heart is deceitful above all things and beyond cure. Who can understand it?

q1.body: The rapid appearance around 530 million years ago of most phyla on earth during a very short period of 5-10 million years.
This view holds that God created in a series of interventions, possibly corresponding to the days in Gen. 1, but perhaps not limited to them.
A theory that the entire world was created in six days just as it is today, less than ten thousand years ago.

This form of spirituality is a loosely based movement that includes numerous groups, churches, and philosophies that share common foundational beliefs. It can be traced back to several unconventional religious ideologies including Theosophy (a pantheistic form of ancient Gnosticism) as well as the teaching of Phineas P. Quimby, a psychic healer who greatly influenced a number of mind-science cults (including Christian Science).
Romans 15:14
dictionary: I myself am convinced, my brothers, that you yourselves are full of goodness, complete in knowledge and competent to instruct one another.
q1.response: I myself am convinced, my brothers, that you yourselves are full of goodness, complete in knowledge and competent to instruct one another.

dictionary: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly as you teach and admonish one another with all wisdom, and as you sing psalms, hymns and spiritual songs with gratitude in your hearts to God.
q1.response: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly as you teach and admonish one another with all wisdom, and as you sing psalms, hymns and spiritual songs with gratitude in your hearts to God.

q1.response: For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.

q1.response: Greater love has no one than this, that he lay down his life for his friends.

dictionary: It is not rude, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs.
q1.response: It is not rude, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs.

dictionary: Bear with each other and forgive whatever grievances you may have against one another. Forgive as the Lord forgave you.
q1.response: Bear with each other and forgive whatever grievances you may have against one another. Forgive as the Lord forgave you.

q1.body: Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other, just as in Christ God forgave you.

dictionary: Brothers, if someone is caught in a sin, you who are spiritual should restore him gently. But watch yourself, or you also may be tempted.
q1.response: Brothers, if someone is caught in a sin, you who are spiritual should restore him gently. But watch yourself, or you also may be tempted.

q1.body: __________ __________ stresses rational arguments for the existence of God and uses evidence to substantiate biblical claims and miracles. Arguments such as the cosmological, teleological, and ontological arguments are types of ____________ _____________.
______________________  refers to how much weight of proof a particular debater must bear. As Christian apologists, we argue that we have no more burden of proof than any other worldview.
Drag the term to its definition.
options: is a theory of evolution holding that evolutionary change in the fossil record came in fits and starts rather than in a steady process of slow change. The significance of this theory is that the gaps in the fossil record are explained by these leaps forward in evolution, although no explanation is given for why leaps occur.
Refers to the change from non-living chemical compounds to the first living organism.
Holds that God created in a series of interventions, possibly corresponding to the days in Gen. 1, but perhaps not limited to them.
